message_1: A cryptographic hash function takes an input message and produces a fixed-size output, also known as a digest. Let's consider the SHA-256 hash function. If the input message consists of 432 bits, what will be the length of the output digest produced by the SHA-256 hash function?
message_2: The output digest length produced by the SHA-256 hash function is always 256 bits, regardless of the input message size.
